description: This table contains the Primary Care Provider (PCP) information for your patients over time. It can also contain data about providers that are not PCPs but are still on the patients' EpicCare-Ambulatory care teams.

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: PCP_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID associated with the provider record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: EFF_DATE
columns.description: The date from which the provider is in effect as the member�s PCP.

columns.name: TERM_DATE
columns.description: The last date for which the provider was the member�s PCP.

columns.name: PCP_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with the type of the PCP. This is only populated when the provider is a patient's PCP and is null otherwise.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


General

columns.name: SPECIALTY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The specialty category ID for the patient care team member.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: RESULTS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The results to receive category ID for the patient care team member.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No results


Abnormal results only


All results

columns.name: PCP_MESSAGE_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether a provider on a patient's care team wishes to be included as a recipient of messages sent to the patient's PCP. A �Y� indicates that the provider wishes to receive messages, a �N� indicates that the provider does not wish to receive the messages.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: RELATIONSHIP_C_NAME
columns.description:
The relationship to patient category ID for the patient care team member.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: OTHER_NAME
columns.description: The name for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.

columns.name: OTHER_ADDRESS
columns.description: The address for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.  Lines are delimited with character 9s.

columns.name: OTHER_PHONE
columns.description: The phone number for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.

columns.name: OTHER_PAGER
columns.description: The pager number for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.

columns.name: OTHER_FAX
columns.description: The fax number for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.

columns.name: OTHER_EMAIL
columns.description: The email address for patient care team members that don't have a provider and resource record.

columns.name: PCP_HX_COMMENTS
columns.description: Free text comments that can be entered for a provider that is part of the care team for this patient.

columns.name: PCP_ADDRESS_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the address in the provider record that should be used to contact the patient's PCP. This column is frequently used in conjunction with the PCP_PROV_ID column to link to the CLARITY_SER_ADDR table.
